page.title: 09Armed services in Gillingham
page.content: Gillingham has had a long traditional contact with the armed forces but in 1984 the Naval Dockyard closed and much of the barracks have closed in the past few years. Today the only things left at the Dockyard by the Navy is the ropery, a few warehouses and the cranes. Few R.N. ships come in now, the last ship to leave was HMS Hermione. There are quite a few regiments at Brompton Barracks such as the Royal Marines Reserve, The Ghurkas and the Royal Engineers. You often see them jogging along the road in full kit. Once a year they let people walk round the barracks. The Royal Marines also have a band and play on special occasions. The Royal Engineers construct very strong bridges in a very short time, they are a very elite force.
